excerpt: for my first pick you know I got to go with Google probably my number one most favorite stock in the entire market and look seeing their stock fall Fall by over 133% in the past week and down over 15% from the top for me that's a good enough dip to be adding a little more to my position here and that's because Google continues to dominate virtually all parts of the internet Market which in my opinion is the most important Market of all and as their most recent earnings showed Google is not even really slowing down I mean sales reached almost $85 billion in a single quarter and that was still up4 15% year-over-year with net income profits also skyrocketing by almost 30% up to almost 24 billion these are very strong margins that we're talking about here very strong profitability and I believe that there's even more to come in the future Google is the third largest cloud provider in the world we know how profitable that is for Amazon of course but Google is just getting started there reporting a record one billion in operating profit for the first time ever last quarter YouTube is also capturing more viewers than any other streamer in the world including even Netflix and when you look at Apple the most highly valued company in the world well Google is trying to imitate them with their own pixel lineup of products and services all through Android which they also own too and by the way they have a new lineup getting announced this upcoming week for the pixel 9 lineup of phones including also a new foldable which I'm excited to take a look at myself too all of which will have more AI integration in them as as well through Gemini which I do feel they're beating Apple to the punch on as well so I just think Google is on fire and the stock is a Buy on any significant dips

we know how profitable that is for Amazon of course. all right moving on if you feel C3 is just way too risky well I totally understand I agree that it is a very high-risk stock but stock number four it's about as solid of a pickup as I could really make right now in the market very dependable I have almost the same amount of conviction for it as I do for Google and that is of course the mighty Amazon ticker symbol amzn who also saw a dip this past week losing over 10 10% while also being down about 177% in the past month coming off of earnings That Wall Street didn't really approve of but that I actually thought were phenomenal especially for their size with sales still Rising by a double digit rate despite them already doing close to $150 billion in a single quarter that is insane and most important of all Amazon continues to show progress on the bottom line which used to be their biggest critique well in the past quarter they almost doubled it so there's really nothing to complain about it anymore I feel when it comes to Amazon and their performance they're the number one cloud provider in the world and yet they still managed to grow it by almost 20% it's wild plus they're also investing heavier into AI now too mentioning recently that they're basically buying up as many Nvidia gpus as they can get their hands on to run AI training and generative AI models with the goal being to generate billions in new Revenue from that too so again the story with Amazon continues to be that even for their incredibly massive size they still continue to find new ways to grow and in the future by the way I feel that when they do finally start turning their attention more heavily into profitability rather than Revenue growth I think the valuation will actually actually look much more attractive at today's levels Than People realize
YouTube is also capturing more viewers than any other streamer in the world including even Netflix
YouTube is also capturing more viewers than any other streamer in the world including even Netflix and shaping up to easily be considered the next Netflix of gaming type of service

and when you look at Apple the most highly valued company in the world well Google is trying to imitate them with their own pixel lineup of products and services all through Android which they also own too and by the way they have a new lineup getting announced this upcoming week for the pixel 9 lineup of phones including also a new foldable which I'm excited to take a look at myself too all of which will have more AI integration in them as as well through Gemini which I do feel they're beating Apple to the punch on as well

stock number two I'm going with Cisco probably my favorite value dividend type of stock in the market right now or at least a big Contender for that spot with another 6% drop this past week and despite them closing on a very important acquisition of cloud and AI specialist Splunk probably my favorite acquisition of the year by the way and yet the stock is actually negative year to date at these levels their adjusted PE is not only 12% cheaper than their 5-year average but also 42% cheaper than the sector median while the dividend has also risen to about 3 and 1.2% yield which is also among the highest levels that it's ever really reached so I just think Cisco has been undervalued for a while now and it is a great pickup here they have faced Financial pressures in the past without a lot of growth but recent moves shifting heavier into a higher margin softwar driven business especially in Cloud Ai and even cyber security I think will pay off for them long term as those are all very high growth markets with lots of future potential
despite them closing on a very important acquisition of cloud and AI specialist Splunk probably my favorite acquisition of the year by the way

speaking of AI though stock number three well it literally has it in its name and their ticker symbol and that is c3.ai ticker symbol AI who's now seen close to a 20% fall in the the past month while also being down over 80% from the 2020 IPO a big reason for that it was overhyped to begin with during a rise in Ai and internet-based stocks that later fell heavily on the weakening economy and because C3 has not been profitable while the rising interest rate environment has scared investors into selling and even shorting the stock heavily because of that lack of profits however if interest rates start coming down soon this could be one heck of a turnaround play here as there business often reminds me of that of palente teers except at a much smaller scale but also with a lot of that similar potential as they basically use AI to improve the operational efficiency and effectiveness of other businesses which is very similar to what paler does too and it's in very high demand now I'm not saying that they're the same I'm not even saying that they're really all that comparable I'm just saying that there are some similarities here that could Propel the stock higher over the long term as AI becomes more important and more heavily used by businesses and especially at these beaten down levels in the stock price I think it looks very attractive

as there business often reminds me of that of palente teers except at a much smaller scale but also with a lot of that similar potential as they basically use AI to improve the operational efficiency and effectiveness of other businesses which is very similar to what paler does too and it's in very high demand now I'm not saying that they're the same I'm not even saying that they're really all that comparable I'm just saying that there are some similarities here that could Propel the stock higher over the long term as AI becomes more important and more heavily used by businesses

upping the risk a little bit though for stock number five I'm actually going to go with a bit of a Tesla competitor in General Motors symbol GM and for this one you know my thesis is pretty simple I often get comments on this one whenever I mention that I like GM stock I get comments from some people calling me an idiot saying that Tesla is so much better and that how you know how could I talk about GM when Tesla's out there but uh that's never really been at all my point with GM I don't look at General Motors as an alternative investment to Tesla I actually have a huge position in Tesla whereas GM is a very tiny one by comparison and I don't buy GM stock with the idea that they'll overtake Tesla in anything and especially not in AI energy robotics or any other kind of revolutionary Technologies I simply own a small piece of GM stock for being a cheap and I would argue undervalued automaker that is more likely to survive longterm in an EV and a even autonomous driving Market that is more than big enough to support multiple players like Tesla and GM and when I look at the valuation it just makes sense to me now more recently the stock dipped again losing close to 10% in the past month while also being down about a third of its value from the top and also looking relatively flat over the past decade which leaves behind a dirt cheap valuation that is enormously cheaper than the sector in fact their Ford p is only less than five and over 71% cheaper than the sector 2 and yet I actually think that the business is doing pretty well right now with last quarter in particular beating analyst expectations on both the top and bottom line while raising cash flow guidance and growing their adjusted profits by a massive 37% on also record sales that's not to say that there aren't any issues notably they're declining business in China that remains a concern they're trying to work on it doing restructurings within the business and stuff like that but even with EVS for example they've made significant progress with last quarter seeing a 40% spike in EV sales despite the market being very unfavorable to them right now of course the other major thing holding GM back has been the economy and Rising interest rates that make it too expensive for consumers to buy new cars but if Freight start coming down soon don't be surprised if GM actually survives this current downturn a lot better than people expect

now like I said I usually get some not too friendly comments about GM stock and yet that's really nothing compared to stock number six in Disney tiger symbol disis who look I totally get it I'm just as critical as you guys about Disney stock and the quality of the content that Disney has been putting out lately which has been severely lacking especially in Marvel and Star Wars I'm a huge Marvel and Star Wars fan I always have been my whole life and the content that they've been putting out lately has been yeah pretty bad receiving horrible reviews it's just not what customers are really responding to and the quality is just not there so I'm very critical of all of that I just feel that you know I try to be optimistic about the ship being able to be turned around and like I mentioned recently I do think that we're seeing at least some positive signs there notably with Deadpool generating the biggest sales of any R-rated movie in history and also with the announcement of Robert Downey Jr returning as Dr Doom in the Marvel Universe I think they have an opportunity there because of the expanded universe to bring in old characters and different characters and do a lot of creative things that could bring the quality back up again and give customers what they actually want plus another major concern for Disney has always been the heavy cost of video streaming without any profitability to show for it but this past week well they actually reported positive profits for the segment for the first time ever too which I think is another good sign and yet the stock actually fell on concerns of a challenging macroeconomy and how that might affect C customers uh wanting to visit their theme parks and Resorts but with the stock NOW down over 8% in the past week after losing over half its value from the top while also trading for just about the lowest prices of the past decade I just don't think we would have ever got this low of a price for Disney if there weren't some concerns that need to be addressed but at these levels I just can't resist buying some of this stock I happen to like it

All right how about for stock number seven though I bring you back to a fan favorite here that most of you probably like you probably even own it in your portfolio that's right we're going with Nvidia tier s nvda basically the leader of the AI Revolution at this point or at least the most hyped one for it for sure but you know what I'm actually going to include stocks number eight and number nine here as well because I actually think all three of the big American chip developers are going through a large dip that is worth picking up and it really just depends on what characteristic you would prioritize among them the most that would really determine which one is the most attractive here but that of of course includes Nvidia AMD and Intel now when looking at their prices Nvidia lost almost a fifth of its value in the past month AMD lost almost a quarter of its value during the same time and Intel well Intel lost over 40% and is now trading at the lowest prices of the past decade after losing more than 70% of its value from the top and so what I think it will really come down to here differentiating between the three I think with Nvidia you get the number one market share Dom leader in Ai and discreet gpus with close to 100% of the data center GPU Market which is by the way also up five times last year in sales and they have about 88% of desktop GPU market share as well and despite being one of the most highly valued companies in the world now by market cap well their profit growth is so incredibly high that the recent dip left their valuation significantly lower than both their 5-year average on most metrics while also their peeg ratio is even cheaper than the sector too if you can believe it so with that dip and with the growth expected from AI long term I think Nvidia is a buy Here For Those reasons

now when it comes to AMD well you're talking about a little more risk here obviously not as dominant as Nvidia but you're still talking about the second largest in GPU market share there's going to have to be an alternative there businesses will want to turn to someone else too if they can compete on price and other things plus AMD has also been eating away at Intel's Market for CPUs too for a long time they've been the second kind of alternative in that area too so I think they could try to bring some of that success over to gpus with you know competing against Nvidia as well doesn't have to be better than Nvidia doesn't even have to be better than Intel just needs to be a good alternative and when you look at the valuation it's cheaper than the sector even by a larger margin than Nvidia too so that's pretty attractive as well on this dip

and then with Intel you're just you're really just betting on a big recovery here for what used to be the most dominant player in the space and I don't think they need to be number one by the way I just think that they need to do a better job competing with new products in especially artificial intelligence which they are launching multiple for in CPUs gpus and even AI accelerators which are a new type of AI chip and then on top of that they need to cement themselves as really the I would say like the one of the big three to actually build chips in America helping the West diversify away from the East away from Asia which will include huge incentives subsidies and even help uh with them attracting other businesses to build chips for them too and even other developers too so all three of these stocks in my opinion look like a Buy on these dips and I personally own a really big position in Nvidia and then a very uh small position by comparison tiny one really in Intel

okay finally for stock number 10 I got to include my number one large just holding in Microsoft ticker symbol msft who didn't experience quite as large of a fall as many of the other stocks recently but it did at least dip by a double digit percent over the past month despite posting what I thought were once again some of the best earnings that we ever see out of companies in the entire world this past quarter with not only sales still Rising by over 15% on about $65 billion worth of Revenue but net income profits also coming in really high at over 22 billion with about 10% growth there as well and when looking at it Azure Cloud the second largest in the world it continues to grow at around a 30% clip with just about all other parts of their business putting up incredible growth for its size too especially in Xbox gaming which used to be struggling but is now posting growth north of 60% and is shaping up to easily be considered the next Netflix of gaming type of service with already more than half a billion monthly active users across all their platforms which was in large part thanks to the massive Activision acquisition which is just another reason why I love Microsoft stocks so much they are so incredibly profitable that they can afford to just really scoop up other companies left and right to maintain that dominance which you can see on this rolling screenshot here of all their Acquisitions including some very notable ones uh in recent years including like Activision LinkedIn GitHub those are all massive ones that are paying off for them in huge ways and also in artificial intelligence last quarter Microsoft saw more demand from AI for their services than they even had capacity for so like Google like Amazon like Nvidia this is another giant company here that is firing on all cylinders right now that I think is a great one to pick up on any significant dips
